Baltimore's most cited landlords

The Baltimore Sun analyzed data from Maryland Case Search, Baltimore rental registrations, Open Baltimore and other sources to identify landlords and properties that were consistently fined for life, health and safety violations and other infractions.

These are the landlords with the most citations and their properties.

Read more about our methodology.

START

    Baltimore's most cited landlords

    This list was determined using the number of life, health and safety violations revealed in court cases between tenants and landlords.

    The properties on the map are not necessarily those that had violations.

    Read more about our methodology.

Violation definitions

LHS: Life, health and safety violations include violations from the Maryland Judiciary Case Search analyzed by attorneys at the Maryland Volunteer Lawyer Service. These violations revealed in rent court show substandard housing conditions for tenants.

ECB: Environmental control board violations are provided by the Baltimore City Environmental Control Board. These less severe violations range from untidy lawns to pest control.

HABC: The Housing Authority of Baltimore City prosecutes landlords for properties that violate Baltimore's housing code.

Read about our methodology.

Methodology

This interactive is based on case data from the Maryland Judiciary Case Search. Attorneys at the Maryland Volunteer Lawyer Service scraped and analyze case search data to get the life, health and safety violation counts.

Additional addresses affiliated with these landlords were pulled from a database provided by the Housing Authority of Baltimore City.

Due to variations in how landlords' names and companies are listed, matches for properties were sometimes limited. In some cases, landlords split up their properties into multiple companies, making an absolute count of properties unverifiable.

Additional violations information such as Environmental Control Board violations and prosecutions from HABC were provided by their respective entities and matched with known addresses.
